alert.note: Alert for Oakland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 7:26PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Oakland. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - The heaviest rain as now exited the county. Light to briefly moderate rain will persist well into the evening. Additional rainfall amounts should remain less than a half inch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Southfield, Pontiac, Novi, Milford, Holly, Oxford, Royal Oak, Birmingham, Rochester, South Lyon, Northville, Ortonville, West Bloomfield, Clarkston, Detroit Zoo, Farmington Hills, Rochester Hills and Madison Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
